dublin_core.dcvalue: Cardiac surgery traditionally conducted via median sternotomy has been recently forwarded by progressively advanced technology facilitating sternal sparing minimally invasive access to the heart Robotic systems comprised of miniaturized surgical instruments mounted on long thin shafts with multiple degrees of range of motion coupled with a dual camera endoscope providing true three dimentional high magnification visualization have greatly propelled this field
The international journal of medical robotics + computer assisted surgery : MRCAS
